author: Keith McGilvery
title: New teaching techniques in Plainfield
text:
PLAINFIELD, Vt. - Educators in Plainfield are transforming the way students are learning.
New this year -- kids in grades 9 to 12 at Twinfield Union School are trading in some of their textbooks and are each being paired up with a laptop.
The move comes as the school's X-Day program is gaining momentum.
One day a week students are trading in a traditional classroom schedule to spend the bulk of the day in a hands-on workshop environment or in internships in the community gaining real-world experience.
"You get to go out there and experience it, you don't have to sit there and picture it in your mind,” said student Alayna Hull.
“You can take what you want to take in school and have a little more of a background, before you go to college and are like, 'I have no clue,'” said student Michael Russell.
Twinfield Union is also changing its approach to teaching math. This year it's introduced a weekly math lab to reinforce student skills.
